result.execSummary:
The defendant Patrick A Allman was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of Child Pornography, a class D felony, Wisconsin Statutes 948.12(1m).
  • Possession of Child Pornography, a class D felony, Wisconsin Statutes 948.12(1m).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: On Counts #1 & #2, the Court sentences Mr.  Allman to 11 years, with an Initial Term of Confinement in Prison of 4 years and the maximum time to serve on Extended Supervision of 7 years, each count, concurrent; to commence consecutive to any previously imposed sentence

superMiscConds.notes:
--To pay $250 DNA Surcharge 
--To pay costs of $268
--To pay $10,000 Child Pornography Surcharge [$500 each image (20 images)] - $5000 to be applied to Count #1 & $5000 to Count #2

--Complete psychosexual assessment and treatment, per Agent
--To undergo any other assessment, treatment, therapies or counseling, per Agent
--No possession of any pornography of any type except as authorized by Agent
--No possession of a computer or other device capable of accessing the internet unless approved by Agent
--No use of a computer, or other device capable of accessing the internet, except as necessary for work or school purposes in a public place uless Agent consents
--No accessing the internet absent DOC Agent consent
--No contact with any child absent DOC Agent express consent, except for incidental contact at commercial setting (such as stores or restaurants) or at work/school
--Not to be present at places commonly frequented by children (such as K-12 schools & parks), absent express DOC Agent consent
--Defendant shall not engage in occupation or volunteer position that involves working primarily with children under the age of 16 years
--Sex offender registration & reporting under St. 301.45
--To submit DNA Sample upon demand

If probation, parole or extended supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of the victim(s) and government entities for the balance due.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

records.addlTxt:
Case called at 3:40 pm [Clerk SH]
Defendant Patrick A Allman in court, in-custody, with Attorney Jeffrey Jacob De La Rosa. ADA Monica J. Hall appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
On Motion of the State, the Court dismisses uncharged additional 20 images located on the Defendant's computer and the 13 images located on the Defendant's smart phone and bars them from further prosecution.
Sentencing arguments by Counsel

On Counts #1 & #2, the Court sentences Mr.  Allman to 11 years, with an Initial Term of Confinement in Prison of 4 years and the maximum time to serve on Extended Supervision of 7 years, each count, concurrent; to commence consecutive to any previously imposed sentence

The Court finds that the Defendant is NOT eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program (Boot Camp) and the Substance Abuse Program. 
The Court gives 119 days credit for time already served.

The Court orders as conditions of Extended Supervision:
--To pay $500 DNA Surcharge ($250 each count)
--To pay costs of $536 ($268 each count)
--To pay $10,000 Child Pornography Surcharge [$500 each image (20 images)] - $5000 to be applied to Count #1 & $5000 to Count #2
--Complete psychosexual assessment and treatment, per Agent
--To undergo any other assessment, treatment, therapies or counseling, per Agent
--No possession of any pornography of any type except as authorized by Agent
--No possession of a computer or other device capable of accessing the internet unless approved by Agent
--No use of a computer, or other device capable of accessing the internet, except as necessary for work or school purposes in a public place uless Agent consents
--No accessing the internet absent DOC Agent consent
--No contact with any child absent DOC Agent express consent, except for incidental contact at commercial setting (such as stores or restaurants) or at work/school
--Not to be present at places commonly frequented by children (such as K-12 schools & parks), absent express DOC Agent consent
--Defendant shall not engage in occupation or volunteer position that involves working primarily with children under the age of 16 years
--Sex offender registration & reporting under St. 301.45
--To submit DNA Sample upon demand

Felony Firearm and Voting-rights prohibitions/warnings given
Explanation of Determinate Sentence form given to the Defendant
Atty De La Rosa clarifies comments re: prior registration
Recess: 4:44 pm
With elements and criminal case settlement agreement forms attached.
Sentencing hearing on December 18, 2014 at 03:30 pm.

Case called at 10:54 am [Clerk SH] (Case was scheduled for STC)
Defendant Patrick A Allman in court, in-custody, with Attorney Jeffrey Jacob De La Rosa. ADA Monica J. Hall appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Atty De La Rosa: Were prepared to go to plea/sentencing; however after speaking with ADA Hall, State does need more before sentencing. Request date next week for sentencing.
ADA Hall: Have not yet received final analysis of the computer, need some more time to gather information. 
Upon questioning of the Court, ADA Hall indicates 1 week should be enough time to obtain information

Constitutional rights reviewed; maximum penalties recited; plea of "No Contest" entered on Counts #1 & #2; factual basis stipulated; victim rights compliance verified; Court finds the plea has been entered freely, voluntarily, intelligently and accepts the plea, finds the Defendant  guilty, and orders JOC entered.
On Motion of the State, the Court reads-in and dismisses Counts #3, #4, #5 & #6
Court revokes bond
Recess: 11:06 am 

NEXT: Notices given in Court -  Sentencing hearing scheduled for December 18, 2014 at 03:30 pm.
Status conference on December 11, 2014 at 10:30 am.

case called at 11:07am. [MK]
Defendant Patrick A Allman in court, in custody, with Attorney Jeffrey J De La Rosa.  ADA Brookellen Teuber appears for the State of Wisconsin.
Mr. Allman's letter-request for appointment of new Public Defender counsel is scheduled for hearing today.  
ADA Teuber and Attorney De La Rosa indicate they have no objection to Mr. Allman's request. Attorney De La Rosa indicates that the PD can appoint successor counsel. 
However Mr. Allman withdraws his request for new counsel; he indicates that he met earlier today with Attorney De La Rosa and he is satisfied with Attorney De La Rosa's representation. 
The Court and counsel discuss scheduling. 
recess 11:11am. 

NEXT:  Status Conference (likely plea/sentencing) on 12/11/14 at 10:30am.
This request will be considered at the status hearing on 11-6-14. cc: All w/notice
From the defendant requesting new counsel

Case called at 9:09 am [Clerk SH]
[Reserve Judge Neal Nettesheim presiding for BrIV]
Defendant Patrick A Allman in court, in-custody, with Attorney Jeffrey Jacob De La Rosa. ADA Jeffrey Martin Shock appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Atty De La Rosa indicates that he will speak to issue; but not to motion as it frivlous. Informs the Court that Ms. Allman's mother is not the sole owner of home, so therefore it can not be used as property bond. Understand that other owner of home is unwilling to commit to property bond.
Statements by Mr. Allman
Court presents basis, denies motion to modify bond, orders bond to stand as fixed; Court will hear motion in future if there is change in cricumstances w/property
Recess: 9:13 am 

NEXT: Case to remain as scheduled
Bail/bond hearing on October 17, 2014 at 09:00 am.
Set for bail review hearing cc: All w/notice
from Defendant requesting a bond modification
Status conference on November 6, 2014 at 11:00 am.
Pre-trial conference on October 15, 2014 at 10:00 am.

Case called at 3:01 pm [Clerk SH]
[Reserve Judge Sarah O'Brien presiding for BrIV]
Defendant Patrick A Allman in court, in custody, with Attorney Jeffrey Jacob De La Rosa. ADA DA Jeffrey Martin Shock appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Atty De La Rosa submits Demand for Discovery and Inspection

Court examines the Defendant as to rights, understanding & intent.  
Mr. Allman waives his right to Preliminary Hearing; the Court accepts this waiver and binds him over for Arraignment.
State files information

Arraignment:
--service of Information admitted, reading waived
--maximum penalties recited
--pleas of "not guilty" entered
Court continues bond; deadline for filing motions is to be held open

NEXT: (1) DA PTC scheduled for 10/15/14 at 10:00 am - Send notices (2) STC scheduled for 11/6/14 at 11:00 am - Send notices
Preliminary hearing on August 29, 2014 at 02:45 pm.

Case called at 1:27 pm
Defendant Patrick A Allman in custody, via video from the Jefferson County Jail with Attorney Jeffrey De La Rosa from the Jefferson County Public Defenders Office (PD will appoint counsel). ADA Theresa A Beck appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Upon stipulation, the Court finds the video connection to be sight and sound sufficient. 
Court verifies with the Defendant that the DOB and address listed on the criminal complaint are correct.
Service of Complaint admitted; reading waived; charges and maximum penalties recited
Bail/Bond recommendations presented by counsel.

Court requires $10,000.00 CASH bond, with conditions: 
-Not leave the State of Wisconsin
-If he possesses a passport he will tender it to the clerk of court upon his release
-May only use a work computer if it is at his place of employment, may not have employment where it requires him to take a computer home with him
-Not to possess a computer or other types of computer like electronic devices that have the ablility to access the internet
-Not to have any physical contact with any child under the age of 18
-Not to be alone with any child

Court will schedule Preliminary Hearing within 10 day time limit.
Court discusses with the defendant if he has accounts that he can only access by use of the internet he will need to Motion the Court to have use of the internet to access those accounts.

Recess: 1:44 pm
NEXT: (Notices to be mailed)
Preliminary Hearing: 8/29/14 at 2:45 pm
